com.stormpath.sdk.application.webconfig

Interface ApplicationWebConfig

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Auditable, Resource, Saveable

    public interface ApplicationWebConfig
extends Resource, Saveable, Auditable
    As ApplicationWebConfig resource is used to configure how the application associated to this object behaves in the Stormpath Client Api.

    For example, if you don't want to let users to register to associated the application via the Stormpath Client Api, you need to turn it off. 

     ApplicationWebConfig webConfig = application.getWebConfig();
 webConfig.getRegister().setEnabled(false);
 webConfig.save();

    Or if you want to expands the groups of the account that is access via the /me route. 

     ApplicationWebConfig webConfig = application.getWebConfig();
 webConfig.getMe().getExpansions().setGroups(true);
 webConfig.save();
    Since:
    1.2.0

    • Method Detail

      • getDomainName

        String getDomainName()
        Returns the WebConfiguration's Domain name, this is automatically generated by Stormpath (using the value and is guaranteed to be unique across all tenants in Stormpath.
        Returns:
        the WebConfiguration's Domain name value or null if one hasn't been generated for this resource.

      • getDnsLabel

        String getDnsLabel()
        Returns the current dnsLabel or null if none has been set.
        Returns:
        the current dnsLabel or null if none has been set.

      • setDnsLabel

        ApplicationWebConfig setDnsLabel(String dnsLabel)
        Sets the preferred dnsLabel of the client api domain name.

        Warning: Changing this value will override the domainName value.

        Parameters:
        dnsLabel - to use as part the getDomainName() of this configuration/

      • getStatus

        ApplicationWebConfigStatus getStatus()
        Returns the ApplicationWebConfigStatus's status. Users won't be able to use the Stormpath's Client Api if it's disabled.
        Returns:
        the webConfiguration's status.

      • setStatus

        ApplicationWebConfig setStatus(ApplicationWebConfigStatus status)
        Sets the webConfiguration's status. Users won't be able to use the Stormpath's Client Api if it's disabled.
        Parameters:
        status - the webConfiguration's status.

      • getSigningApiKey

        ApiKey getSigningApiKey()
        Returns the signingApiKey used to sign and/or validate requests and assertions issued by Stormpath's Client Api or null if none is set.
        Returns:
        the signingApiKey used to sign and/or validate requests and assertions issued by Stormpath's Client Api or null if none is set.

      • setSigningApiKey

        ApplicationWebConfig setSigningApiKey(ApiKey apiKey)
        Sets the apiKey to be used by Stormpath's Client Api to sign request and assertions. If set to null the Stormpath Client Api won't be available for users.
        Parameters:
        apiKey - to be used by Stormpath's Client Api to sign request and assertions. If set to null the Stormpath Client Api won't be available for users.
